title: Home
text:
Hello I am Dalila [Dah-LEE-lah] Lara [La-ruh]!


I am passionate about leveraging my data science background to generate insights that promote environmental sustainability and conservation.Â  I hold a Master of Environmental Data Science from the Bren School of Environmental Science & Management at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB).Â Throughout my academic journey and practical experiences both in the field and beyond, Iâ€™ve come to recognize the paramount significance of data collection and analysis in environmental science. I am driven to continually enhance my data science expertise to equip myself as a proficient environmental researcher. My goal is to apply my skills to drive sustainability and conservation, while fostering the inclusion of underrepresented minorities in the field of environmental science. 

Experience
- Post-Graduate Intern, NREL (12/23 â€“ 12/24)
- Graduate Fellow, UCSB - Smithsonian Scholars Program (9/22 - 8/23)
- Data Science Intern, Smithsonian OCIO Data Science Lab (6/21 - 8/21)
- Data Science Intern, National Park Services (3/21 - 6/21)

Education
- Master of Environmental Data Science (MEDS), UCSBÂ (2023)
- Bachelor of Arts in Biological Anthropology, UCSBÂ (2022)
- Bachelor of Arts in Global Studies, UCSB (2022)

title: Home
text:
Iâ€™m Dalila Lara a student in the Masterâ€™s of Environmental Data Science (MEDS) program at the Bren School of Environmental Science & Management at UCSB. I plan to use my learned data science skills towards environmental sustainability and conservation, all while empowering underrepresented minorities to enter the field of environmental science.



- June 2021 - August 2021: Intern Smithsonian Office of Chief Information Officer (OCIO) Data Science Lab
- March 2021 - June 2021: Data Science Intern National Park Services (NPS)



- MEDS (Expected June 2023): Master of Environmental Data Science (UC Santa Barbara)
- BA (2022): Biological Anthropology & Global Studies (UC Santa Barbara)
